alert.note: Alert for Oceana (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Oceana County through 230 PM EDT... At 150 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Hart, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hart... Hesperia... Pentwater... Weare... Elbridge... Colfax... Walkerville... Crystal Valley... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
